pageContext.collection_description:
Collection includes a number of lesser-known and documented radio programs, particularly from local or early radio.  Examples of some well-known programs are included, such as original AFRS pressings of key "Suspense" episodes, such as "Sorry Wrong Number", "Dick Tracy in B Flat", and programs marking the end of WWII.  Also included in collection is original Mercury Theater file copy of the "War of the Worlds" broadcast, which appears to be one of only two known complete copies of the program.  Collection concentrates on early radio (up to the mid-30s), lesser-known WWII related material, soap operas, and lesser documented syndicated programming from the 1940s and early 50s.

NOTE: Originally submitted as a personal collection, prior to acquisition by Duke, as 'rand's esoteric our.'
pageContext.extent: Personal collection of original 16" radio transcriptions and lacquers primarily documenting lesser-known radio programs, spanning the period from the late 1920s through 1960.  Collection is primarily pressed 16" transcriptions, but also includes lacquers, some pressed 78 rpm discs and open reel audio tape, and examples of pressing plates used to manufacture 16" radio transcriptions.  Programs are in a wide variety of genres.  Collection also includes high-quality digital encodes of program material and high-resolution scans of disc labels.
collectionFormats: Digital audio file (including MP3, WAV, AIFF, etc.)
physical_formats: Digital audio file (including MP3, WAV, AIFF, etc.)
